name: Kanchipuram Silk Sarees
description: World-famous handwoven silk sarees known for their vibrant colors, heavy zari work, and traditional motifs. Each saree takes 10-20 days to weave.
artisanStory: Our families have been weaving these silk masterpieces for over 400 years. Each saree is a testament to generations of skill passed down through families.

name: Thanjavur Paintings
description: Classical South Indian paintings characterized by rich, flat colors, simple iconic composition, glittering gold foils overlaid on delicate gesso work.
artisanStory: Since 1650, our family has preserved the sacred art of Thanjavur painting. Each piece is embellished with precious stones and 22-karat gold.

name: Bhavani Jamakalam
description: Traditional handwoven cotton floor coverings with bold geometric patterns. Used in homes and temples across South India.
artisanStory: We've been weaving these vibrant floor mats for 5 generations. Each pattern tells a story of Tamil culture and tradition.

name: Swamimalai Bronze Sculptures
description: Exquisite bronze idols crafted using the ancient lost-wax casting technique. These sculptures follow strict iconographic guidelines from the Shilpa Shastras.
artisanStory: Our ancestors served the Chola kings as royal sculptors. Today, we continue creating divine forms using 1000-year-old techniques.

name: Thanjavur Bobblehead Dolls
description: Traditional terracotta dolls with a weighted rounded base that causes them to bobble when touched. Symbol of good fortune and prosperity.
artisanStory: These dancing dolls have brought joy to Tamil homes for centuries. Each doll is hand-painted with natural dyes and traditional motifs.

name: Pattamadai Silky Mats
description: Finely woven mats made from korai grass that feel as soft as silk. Used for meditation, yoga, and special occasions.
artisanStory: The korai grass from our region creates mats so fine they can be folded to fit in a matchbox. A gift worthy of royalty.

name: Kumbakonam Brass Lamps
description: Intricately designed brass oil lamps (vilakkus) used in temples and homes. Each lamp is hand-crafted with detailed engravings.
artisanStory: Our brass lamps have illuminated Tamil temples for generations. Each design follows ancient Agama shastra specifications.

name: Kovai Cora Cotton
description: Premium quality cotton fabric known for its durability and comfort. Used to make traditional sarees and dhotis.
artisanStory: The Kovai Cora cotton is woven from hand-spun yarn, making it extremely breathable and perfect for our tropical climate.

name: Dindigul Locks
description: World-famous handmade locks known for their durability and intricate mechanism. Each lock is unique and virtually unpickable.
artisanStory: Our locks have protected valuables for over 200 years. Each lock takes 3-4 hours to craft and has over 500 internal components.

name: Madurai Sungudi Sarees
description: Tie-and-dye cotton sarees with distinctive dotted patterns. The natural dyes and traditional techniques make each saree unique.
artisanStory: The Sungudi technique creates thousands of tiny dots that form beautiful patterns. It's a labor of love passed through generations.

name: Chettinad Athangudi Tiles
description: Handmade cement tiles with vibrant colors and intricate patterns. Each tile is individually crafted without the use of machines.
artisanStory: These tiles have adorned Chettinad mansions for over a century. Each tile is sun-dried and cured for 21 days before use.

name: Tirunelveli Wheat Halwa
description: A traditional sweet made from wheat, ghee, and sugar. The unique taste comes from the water of the Thamirabarani river.
artisanStory: Our shop has been making halwa in the dark (Iruttu) for over 100 years. The dim lighting helps us judge the perfect consistency by sound and feel.
